remarks: If ` K ` divides ` N ` but ` K ` does not divide ` M ` then ` M + N ` cannot be zero.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Apr-2020.)
statement:
etransclem9.k $e |- ( ph -> K e. ZZ ) $.
etransclem9.kn0 $e |- ( ph -> K =/= 0 ) $.
etransclem9.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
etransclem9.n $e |- ( ph -> N e. ZZ ) $.
etransclem9.km $e |- ( ph -> -. K || M ) $.
etransclem9.kn $e |- ( ph -> K || N ) $.
etransclem9 $p |- ( ph -> ( M + N ) =/= 0 ) $.
